events.message: The customer reported a collision involving their car with significant front-end damage at an intersection.
Upon review, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the keywords found in the initial report.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the case and communicate directly with the claimant.
The claimant was sent a confirmation acknowledging receipt of their accident claim and next steps.
The insurance company requested photos of the damaged vehicle, a police report, and repair estimates.
Customer uploaded all requested documents including police report, repair receipts, and accident photos.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted materials and verifying the accident details.
Investigation successfully concluded confirming liability and extent of damages matching documents.
A settlement offer was sent to the customer based on the damage estimate and policy coverage details.
The claimant responded with approval of the settlement amount and expressed satisfaction with the process.
The claim was officially approved following customer consent to the proposed settlement agreement.
The settlement payment was processed and released to the claimant's designated bank account.
The claim file was closed after confirmation of settlement payment receipt and case completion.
The completed claim was archived in the company system for future reference and compliance purposes.
